quotes.quote: Our Savior is our true Mother in whom we are endlessly born and out of whom we shall never come.
The savior who wants to turn men into angels is as much a hater of human nature as the totalitarian despot who wants to turn them into puppets.
A zealous Savior ought to have zealous disciples.
The Savior's atonement...is intimate as well as infinite.
Recognizing the Savior's spiritual light begins with our willingness to believe.
With the Savior's power and light we will be enabled to push back the darkness of the world.
The Savior empowers us with His grace, not because we've earned it, but because He loves us perfectly.
You have the Savior of the world on your side. If you seek His help and follow His directions, how can you fail?
The Savior knows the difficulties of the way and can guide us through whatever sorrows and disappointments may come.
The Savior taught us to love not only our friends but also those who disagree with us- and even those who repudiate us.
The proper task of the Savior is that he is a savior; indeed, for this he came into the world: to seek and save what was lost.
If the Savior has not sanctified you, renewed you, given you a hatred of sin and a love of holiness, He has nothing in you of a saving character.
The Savior isn't our last chance; He is our only chance. Our only chance to overcome self-doubt and catch a vision of who we may become. Our only chance to repent and have our sins washed clean.

Our Savior kneels down and gazes upon the darkest acts of our lives. But rather than recoil in horror, he reaches out in kindness and says, "I can clean that if you want." And from the basin of his grace, he scoops a palm full of mercy and washes away our sin.
The Savior can wipe away our tears of regret.
The Savior knows what it's like to die of cancer.
A crucified Savior is not well served by self-pleasing, self-indulging people.
The Savior accomplished the Atonement, which resolves the most terrible burdens that can occur in this life.
The Savior will let you feel the love He feels for those you serve. The call is an invitation to become like Him.
The Savior was selfless. He viewed himself and his own needs as secondary, and he ministered to others tirelessly, lovingly, effectively.
Our Savior gave Himself in unselfish service. He taught that each of us should follow Him by denying ourselves of selfish interests in order to serve others.
Recognizing the Savior's spiritual light begins with our willingness to believe.
